docs.snippet: The island nation’s geothermal heat is often used to bake bread, but our writer wondered if it could fire a whole meal — then set out to do that.

headline.print_headline: Yes, You Can Cook Over a Geyser
headline.main: Why Cook Over an Icelandic Geyser? Because You Can

docs.snippet: Schools have seen more threats and false alarms since the recent shooting in Parkland, Fla. “We can no longer say, ‘Aww, he didn’t mean it,’” an Illinois officer says.

headline.print_headline: A False Alarm? A True Threat? It’s a Fine Line
headline.main: Anatomy of a School Lockdown: A Threat, Then the Anxious Wait

docs.snippet: Bordeaux is renowned for its chateaus and grandiosity. But this corner remains a land of small family farms, even if the wines are magnificent.

headline.main: In Pomerol, Wines of Grandeur From Modest Estates

docs.snippet: With an outbreak in its second year, officials are trying to vaccinate 23 million people against the virus. The government was slow to act, critics say.

headline.print_headline: Fast-Moving Yellow Fever Circles Brazil’s Cities
headline.main: Yellow Fever Circles Brazil’s Huge Cities

docs.snippet: A fierce storm downed power lines, forced the cancellation of thousands of flights and inundated coastal roads with churning seawater on Friday.

headline.main: Nor’easter Live Updates: At Least 5 Die as Storm Topples Trees and Strands Travelers

docs.snippet: NASA’s new spacecraft, to be launched next month, will give scientists a much clearer view of the planets orbiting stars near to us.

headline.main: Meet TESS, Seeker of Alien Worlds

docs.snippet: Spotify has revived the fortunes of recording artists, funneling billions of dollars to music companies. But a charity Spotify is not.

headline.main: Spotify Is Getting Paid to Save the Music Industry: DealBook Briefing

docs.snippet: Lawmakers in both parties are recalibrating their positions on gun control in the wake of the massacre at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School.

headline.print_headline: Guns Create a Political Minefield in the Midterms
headline.main: Parkland Massacre Thrusts Guns Into the Midterm Spotlight

docs.snippet: Surplus weapons left over from Yugoslavia’s civil war are being sold to Swedish gangs, making crime and immigration hot-button issues.

headline.print_headline: Grenades and Gang Violence Rattle Sweden
headline.main: Hand Grenades and Gang Violence Rattle Sweden’s Middle Class

docs.snippet: Russians had wondered before Mr. Putin’s speech what he planned for his last term, and they got an answer: Russia will be a superpower again.

headline.print_headline: Putin Says He Has ‘Invincible’ Nuclear Missile
headline.main: Putin’s ‘Invincible’ Missile Is Aimed at U.S. Vulnerabilities
